dt: used as a function word to make negative a group of words or a word
used as a function word to stand for the negative of a preceding group of words

dt.t: is sometimes hard to see and sometimes {wi}not{/wi}

et: Middle English, alteration of {it}nought{/it}, from {it}nought{/it}, pronoun {ma}{mat|naught|}{/ma}
shortdef: —used as a function word to make negative a group of words or a word
—used as a function word to stand for the negative of a preceding group of words

dt: {bc}a logical operator {dx_def}see {dxt|operator||3a}{/dx_def} that produces a statement that is the inverse {dx_def}see {dxt|inverse:2||3a}{/dx_def} of an input statement

shortdef: a logical operator that produces a statement that is the inverse of an input statement

dt.t: Becoming friends with your boss is {it}not a bad thing{/it}.

shortdef: something that could have good results

dt: used to say that something expected or possible did not happen or is not true

dt.t: Am I tired? {it}Not a bit of it{/it}.
I thought she'd be angry, but {it}not a bit of it{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that something expected or possible did not happen or is not true

dt: {bc}not even a very small amount {bc}not the slightest bit

dt.t: I told them what I wanted, but they didn't take {it}a blind bit{/it} of notice.
It does not make {it}a blind bit{/it} of difference what you do.

shortdef: not even a very small amount : not the slightest bit

meta.id: not a dry eye in the house
stems: not a dry eye in the house

hwi.hw: not a dry eye in the house

dt: used to say that everyone in the audience in a theater or concert hall has tears in their eyes

dt.t: When the movie ended, there was{it}n't a dry eye in the house{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that everyone in the audience in a theater or concert hall has tears in their eyes

dt: used to describe a person who is somewhat strange or stupid

dt.t: Her aunt is very sweet but {it}not all there{/it} (mentally).

shortdef: —used to describe a person who is somewhat strange or stupid

dt.t: The doctor arrived {it}not a moment too soon{/it}.

dt: {bc}to not consist of very much or of anything of importance

dt.t: The evidence did{it}n't amount to much{/it}.

shortdef: to not consist of very much or of anything of importance
